files.description: Implements a blocking validation checklist for intake that rejects tasks missing verbatim claim, source context, or provenance anchor and applies DOI-missing defaults for date range (2019–2025) plus required query keywords/author fields.
Defines a JSON Schema for intake tasks enforcing required claim/source/provenance fields and conditional defaults/requirements when DOI is absent.
Normalizes incoming intake JSON by filling defaults (including 2019–2025 date range) and deriving required query fields when DOI is missing before validation.
Provides a single entrypoint function and CLI to normalize then validate intake tasks against the checklist and JSON Schema with clear blocking error outputs.
Defines structured error types and helpers to format blocking validation failures for intake consumers and logs.
End-to-end tests covering rejection of missing verbatim claim/source context/provenance anchor and DOI-missing defaulting behavior for date range and query keyword/author requirements.
Configures project metadata and dependencies (including a JSON Schema validator) plus test runner settings for the intake validation implementation.

missionDescription: Translate the minimum inputs into a blocking validation checklist (and/or JSON Schema) used by intake: reject tasks missing verbatim claim, source context, and provenance anchor; add defaults for date range (2019–2025) and required query keywords/author fields when DOI is missing.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete the urgent task identified by Meta-Coordinator

Curated insight (actionability 8-9/10): Defines minimum viable inputs for primary-source verification (claim text + dataset/DOI/link or at least research area), which can be converted into enforceable validation rules for intake and evidenc...
